summary: This document discusses financial arrangements related to Jeffrey Epstein, including the establishment of companies and accounts. It mentions Epstein's past legal issues, including settlements and a lie detector test regarding allegations of underage involvement. The document also lists individuals involved in inquiries related to Epstein's financial activities.

persons.name: Jeffrey E. Epstein
persons.context: Epstein is mentioned as the signatory on accounts for his companies and has a history of legal issues, including a 2008 conviction.

persons.name: Jeanne Brennan
persons.context: Brennan is listed as an individual involved in inquiries related to Epstein's financial activities.

persons.name: Harry Beller
persons.context: Beller is mentioned as part of the inquiry team regarding Epstein's financial dealings.

persons.name: Richard Kahn
persons.context: Kahn is also listed as an individual involved in inquiries related to Epstein's financial activities.

locations: 6100 Red Hook Quarter B3 St. Thomas USVI 00802
6100 Red Hook Quarter 83 St. Thomas USVI 00802
keyFacts: Epstein has taken a lie detector test claiming he was unaware that women were underage.
Since his 2008 conviction, Epstein has made 17 out-of-court settlements.
The document outlines the formation of Southern Financial LLC and Southern Trust Company, Inc.
Jeffrey E. Epstein is the signatory on all accounts for the mentioned companies.
The nature of business for Southern Trust Company includes consulting services relying on financial and biomedical algorithms.
